comment._content: nla.gov.au/nla.news-article16119046 this looks like a companion pic...though the SMH had the negative the wrong way around for some reason

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] My gosh! Thanks Quasymody, I had seen that image but not looked at it closely enough to realise they were so similar. Everyone is sitting in the same spots (but back to front) and in slightly different poses. It has to be the same day! The photos in this batch are slowly being digitised, I'll bet the other images in the article will pop up in our collection too. Thanks again :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: I'd say that's David Carment in the middle row...looks like he's slung his binocular case over his shoulder again... www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/8201962740/

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Haha Quasymody you just made our day with that find! It is definately the indomitable David Carment and we are sending the image to Mr Carment's great-grandson for his own records :)
